greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period of the Lucas 4-step sequence A073817 mod prime(n).
comment: This sequence is the same as the period of Fibonacci 4-step sequence (A000078) mod prime(n) except for n=103, which corresponds to the prime 563 because the discriminant of the characteristic polynomial x^4-x^3-x^2-x-1 is -563. We have a(n) < prime(n) for primes 563 and A106280.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fibonacci n-Step
mathematica: n=4; Table[p=Prime[i]; a=Join[Table[ -1, {n-1}], {n}]; a=Mod[a, p]; a0=a; k=0; While[k++; s=Mod[Plus@@a, p]; a=RotateLeft[a]; a[[n]]=s; a!=a0]; k, {i, 60}]
xref: Cf. A106273 (discriminant of the polynomial x^n-x^(n-1)-...-x-1), A106280 (primes p such that x^4-x^3-x^2-x-1 mod p has 4 distinct zeros).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, May 02 2005
